fastBigMath

Class BigMathAdvanced

  • java.lang.Object
    • fastBigMath.BigMathAdvanced

  • public class BigMathAdvanced
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a series of methods capable of performing advanced arithmetic operations on integers of virtually unlimited length. All methods take parameters of type String, which represent the operands. The type String is used, as it permits the representation of arbitrarily large integers, and can be easily manipulated.
    Version:
    05/12/2016
    Author:
    Chaitanya Varier

    • Constructor Detail

      • BigMathAdvanced

        public BigMathAdvanced()

    • Method Detail

      • exponentiate

        public static int[] exponentiate(java.lang.String base,
                                 int pow)
        Computes the exponentiation of a positive integer base raised to a positive integer exponent. The base may be arbitrarily large, however the exponent is restricted to a max value of 231-1.
        Parameters:
        base - The base, represented by a String.
        pow - The exponent, represented by an int.
        Returns:
        an integer array containing the digits of the calculated exponentiation in order.

      • factorialize

        public static int[] factorialize(java.lang.String n)
        Computes the factorial of an arbitrarily large integer.
        Parameters:
        n - The integer operand of the factorial, represented by a String.
        Returns:
        an integer array containing the digits of the calculated factorial in order.

      • primeFactorize

        public static java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> primeFactorize(java.lang.String n)
        Computes the prime factorization of an arbitrarily large integer.
        Parameters:
        n - The integer to be prime factorized, represented by a String.
        Returns:
        a two dimensional ArrayList of type String with dimensions 2*(the number of distinct prime factors of n) containing the prime factors of n and their corresponding quantities.
